Name: Bratislava
Description: The capital region, known for its medieval Old Town, the iconic Bratislava Castle, and vibrant cultural and political life.

Name: Trnava
Description: A historical region known for its well-preserved medieval architecture, vineyards, and the town of Trnava, often called the Slovak Rome.

Name: Nitra
Description: This region is known for its agricultural significance, historical castles, and the town of Nitra, one of the oldest cities in Slovakia.

Name: Žilina
Description: Located in the northwestern part of Slovakia, it is known for its proximity to the Tatra Mountains, as well as the city of Žilina.

Name: Presov
Description: A region in eastern Slovakia, known for its historical towns, including the city of Prešov, and beautiful natural landscapes like the High Tatras.

Name: Kosice
Description: The easternmost region, known for the vibrant city of Kosice, a major cultural and economic hub in Slovakia.

Name: Banska Bystrica
Description: Located in central Slovakia, known for its mountainous landscape, mining heritage, and the city of Banská Bystrica.

Name: Trencin
Description: A region in the west of Slovakia, famous for its medieval castles, including the Trenčín Castle, and proximity to the Czech Republic.
